title: How to Paint Your Nails Without Making a Mess

steps.headline: Smear it around your nail.
steps.description: Place it directly on your skin, using a Q-tip.

steps.headline: Start painting your nails as usual.
steps.description: Use appropriate care, knowing however that small brush strokes onto the skin will be easy to remove.

steps.headline: Peel off the glue after use.
steps.description: It will lift up any nail polish that went onto it. Dispose of appropriately.

steps.headline: Get rid of any leftover glue as follows: Dip a napkin in water, and spread where the glue is still stuck to your skin.
steps.description: Doing this will make it easier to get rid of.

steps.headline: Put Vaseline or petroleum jelly around your whole nail.
Paint the nails as usual.
steps.description: If any excess polish is on your skin, all you need to do is wipe off the Vaseline and the mess is all gone.

steps.headline: Wash your hands once the polish has firmly dried.

text: Using Elmer's glue Find some liquid Elmers glue.  Smear it around your nail. Place it directly on your skin, using a Q-tip. Start painting your nails as usual. Use appropriate care, knowing however that small brush strokes onto the skin will be easy to remove. Peel off the glue after use. It will lift up any nail polish that went onto it. Dispose of appropriately. Get rid of any leftover glue as follows: Dip a napkin in water, and spread where the glue is still stuck to your skin. Doing this will make it easier to get rid of. Using Vaseline or petroleum jelly Put Vaseline or petroleum jelly around your whole nail. Do this for each nail. Paint the nails as usual. If any excess polish is on your skin, all you need to do is wipe off the Vaseline and the mess is all gone. Wash your hands once the polish has firmly dried.
